      • externalTriggerFakeElement

        protected void externalTriggerFakeElement(IN input,
                              List<TriggerPolicy<IN>> policies)
        This method gets called in case of an grouped windowing in case central trigger occurred and the arriving element causing the trigger is not part of this group. Remark: This is NOT the same as processFakeElement(Object, TriggerPolicy)! Here the eviction using active policies takes place after the call to the UDF. Usually it is done before when fake elements get submitted. This special behaviour is needed to allow the GroupedWindowInvokable to send central triggers to all groups, even if the current element does not belong to the group.
        Parameters:
        input - a fake input element
        policies - the list of policies which caused the call with this fake element

      • processFakeElement

        protected void processFakeElement(Object input,
                      TriggerPolicy<IN> currentPolicy)
        This method processed an arrived fake element The method is synchronized to ensure that it cannot interleave with processRealElement(Object)
        Parameters:
        input - a fake input element
        currentPolicy - the policy which produced this fake element

      • processRealElement

        protected void processRealElement(IN input,
                      List<TriggerPolicy<IN>> triggerPolicies)
        This method processed an arrived real element The method is synchronized to ensure that it cannot interleave with WindowInvokable#processFakeElement(Object).
        Parameters:
        input - a real input element
        triggerPolicies - Allows to set trigger policies which are maintained externally. This is the case for central policies in GroupedWindowInvokable.

      • processRealElement

        protected void processRealElement(IN input)
        This method processed an arrived real element The method is synchronized to ensure that it cannot interleave with WindowInvokable#processFakeElement(Object)
        Parameters:
        input - a real input element

      • evictFirst

        protected void evictFirst()
        This method removes the first element from the element buffer. It is used to provide central evictions in GroupedWindowInvokable

      • isBufferEmpty

        protected boolean isBufferEmpty()
        This method returns whether the element buffer is empty or not. It is used to figure out if a group can be deleted or not when GroupedWindowInvokable is used.
        Returns:
        true in case the buffer is empty otherwise false.

      • emitFinalWindow

        protected void emitFinalWindow(List<TriggerPolicy<IN>> centralTriggerPolicies)
        This method does the final reduce at the end of the stream and emits the result.
        Parameters:
        centralTriggerPolicies - Allows to set trigger policies which are maintained externally. This is the case for central policies in GroupedWindowInvokable.
